t:
As I sit alone in my small, dimly lit apartment, a sense of impending danger hangs heavy in the air that I can't really grasp. Every sound, no matter how faint, sends a jolt of alarm through my already weakened nerves. Creaking floorboards, distant sirens, and even the gentle rustling leaves all take on a sinister quality, intensifying the anxiety that has taken hold of me.

                                                          cont...
c:
Paranoia has become my constant companion, a result of the disbelief and dismissal I faced when sharing my encounters with the ghost of the missing girl. The authorities, whom I should have been able to rely on for protection and support, dismissed my claims as the ramblings of an overactive imagination. Their skepticism has left me feeling vulnerable and abandoned, no one would listen to my pleas for help.

Sleep eludes me, burdened by the weight of fear. The events of the past days replay in my mind like a broken record, each moment serving as a reminder of the mysterious forces that lurk in the shadows. As I lie awake, staring into the darkness, the cat, once belonging to the neighbor, senses my distress and curls up beside me, offering a small source of comfort in this distressing nightmare.

The scent of lavender fills the air, drifting through the cracks in my apartment walls. Its delicate fragrance carries a haunting familiarity, wraping around me. Soon, the sounds beginâ€”a soft, ethereal voice carried by the wind, a gentle tapping against the windowpane. I strain to make out the source, my senses on high alert, but there is no physical form to attribute these ethereal manifestations to.

Is it the ghostly girl, whose fate remains unresolved, reaching out from beyond? Is she trying to communicate, to warn me of the impending danger that looms? Or is it the neighbor, shrouded in secrecy, making her way towards me with sinister intent? I dare not dismiss the possibility, for in this uncertainty, anything seems possible.

My days are numbered, and I am powerless to escape my fate. Fear tightens its grip around my heart with each passing second. I cannot ignore the reality that I am trapped, caught between an unknown force that seeks to extinguish my life. The countdown to my inevitable death begins, time slipping through my fingers as the boundaries between the living and the dead blur.
